review: Come on and buy it already!  I would have paid double and probably triple the price of this thing.  The biggest negative is on Amazon.  COME ON AND MAKE AN APP FOR THIS THING ALREADY!  Regardless, using the chrome browser you can cast your prime videos, and I was surprised to find out that when casting a tab with video, the sound plays on the TV!  I was under the assumption that the video would play on the TV but the sound through the computer.  NOPE... So that made it even better!
author: Heath

review: I find this device to be of very limited use. It essentially turns your TV into a smart TV but with some major restrictions.You control it with either the Chrome browser on a PC, an iPhone, or an Android phone. My wife has an iPhone but I have a Window's phone. I cannot Chromecast from my phone. As for Chromecasting from a PC I have to wonder what the point is - I get better results with an HDMI cable. Furthermore, it doesn't even work when I Chromecast from my old Dell Inspiron - I get a black screen. It's not uncommon for the device not to work at all and it can take several attempts to actually watch something.So we have two controllers: my wife's iPhone and my XPS computer upstairs. My wife is fed up with me borrowing her iPhone to use as a remote.It's an interesting idea, but for us it simply doesn't satisfy our needs. I'm waiting for one of our TVs to break so I can replace it with a smart TV. I think that's a better solution for us.
